column5: I just heard that they are going to a 2 fish limit on Minaki and you can only keep 14" to 17.5". Is this correct?
go back a page or two and you will see a very lengthy post on New Ontario Regulations. IaCraig

From what I read in the Kenora paper it says that you can have 1 walleye over 27.5 inches. It seems that with such a small lower slot that people might be inclined to keep a big fish to eat. I sure hope that this is not the case. I would rather see being able to keep 1 fish say 20 to 22 inch and letting those bigger ones go back alive.
As long as I can catch enough to eat while I'm there, I'll keep coming back to God's country.

[font color=green size=3][b]A 20-22" Walleye has a greater percentage of fertile eggs than a 27.5" Walleye which is older an closer to the end of it's natural lifespan. The MNR sees the value in younger more viable fish to increase the populations.
I agree. I would always like to see someone eat a 28 incher and release 3- 22inchers instead!
